title: 14.3 Interval Trees
content:
Section 14.3

Interval Trees

Summary

Red-black tree augmented to store intervals and find overlaps efficiently.

Key Points

  • Each node stores an interval [low, high]
  • Key = low endpoint of interval
  • Augmented info: max = maximum high endpoint in subtree
  • INTERVAL-SEARCH: find any interval overlapping query interval
  • All operations O(log n)

Pseudocode

INTERVAL-SEARCH(T, i):
    x = T.root
    while x ≠ NIL and i does not overlap x.int:
        if x.left ≠ NIL and x.left.max ≥ i.low:
            x = x.left
        else:
            x = x.right
    return x

Example

Find interval overlapping [15,20]. Go left if left subtree's max ≥ 15, else go right.

Why It Matters

Used in computational geometry, scheduling, database queries.
